title: Never Judge a Vaishnava | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Sri Gaura Mandala Parikrama 2024
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: The Lord accepts the least qualification of the living entity and awards him the highest reward that is a standard of his character therefore who but the Lord can be the ultimate shelter
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the extreme mercy of the Lord, using the example of Putana, and emphasizes that even a small act of devotion is recognized and rewarded by Krishna.
segments.transcript: So, we read from Srimad Bhagavatam, 3rd Canto, Chapter 2, Text 23. The matter of remembrance of Lord Krishna. Translation. Purport. Here is an example of the extreme mercy of Lord, even to his enemy. It is said that a noble man accepts the good qualities of a person of doubtful character, just as one accepts nectar from a stalk of poison. In his babyhood, he was administered deadly poison by Putana, a Shri demon who tried to kill the wonderful baby. And because she was a demon, it was impossible for her to know that the Supreme Lord, even though playing the part of a baby, was no one else than the same Supreme Person. His value as the Supreme Lord did not diminish upon his becoming a baby to please his devotee, Yashoda. The Lord may assume the form of a baby or a shape other than that of a human being, but it doesn't make the slightest difference. He is always the same Supreme. A living creature, however powerful he may become, by dint of severe penance, can never become equal to the Supreme Lord. accepted the motherhood of Putana because she pretended to be an affectionate mother allowing Krishna to suck her breast. The Lord accepts the least qualification of the living entity and awards him the highest reward. That is a standard of his character. Therefore, who but the Lord can be the ultimate
